page.title: 05TRANSPORT - REIGATE/REDHILL
page.content: Reigate & Redhill enjoy{excellent {communications.}The Pilgrim's Way along the North Downs was an important route across the south in the past. It is now a pleasant downland{walk. There are fast regular{trains}from Brighton to Redhill. The journey to London from Redhill takes 35 minutes. A line runs from Reading through Reigate & Redhill to Tonbridge. The town of Redhill grew around the rail junction. The{roads}include the A23(Brighton, Redhill to London). the A217, & A25 (Sevenoaks, Redhill, Reigate, Guildford). The M23 motorway to Sussex can be easily reached, & the M25 goes to Kent. The westward extension of the M25 will be opened soon. Gatwick{airport,}a large employer, is to the south. There are scheduled & charter flights inland and overseas.
